intro: Stenanthella occidentalis, commonly known as the western pincushion plant, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its dense, spiky clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Stenanthella occidentalis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in dry slopes and open woodlands.
